page.title: 08Homestead Farm The Farm
page.content: Homestead Farm is made up of four farms joined together.It is{168 acres. There are{26 fields.}Years ago they were known by names but now they are just called 7 acre or 10 acre. Mr. Priddle employs{2 men}and 1 other occasionally when they are busy. Mr. Priddle's last{holiday}was 3 years ago. The workers get 4 weeks a year plus public holidays which means 6 weeks altogether. He considers it a very hard life.They start at 6 in the morning and when they are cutting silage they work until 10 at night. The cows stay{indoors}in the{winter from the end of September till April. They have cow cubicles in 2 big barns. They are strawed every day and the passages are scraped and the manure put in a pit. The cows are calving from the end of August to the end of Mareh.
